TopicTitle: Did we find all of the easter eggs yet?

Articles.Content: Just wondering, because you may never know, we may be missing one or even some!

I'm sure there's one we haven't found yet,

but...

we'll never know...

I believe there is, and I would be willing to fly with you to find it. *salute*

*Insert seriously serious face here*

I'm sure there's one we haven't found yet,

but...

we'll never know...

NEW EASTER EGGS CONFIRMED

Get hunting, everyone!

I vote, uhh er, Pol!

Should we look on Pol first? Its underused, so its most likely to have an easter egg.

Plus, its perdy.
Well, if someone can give me a list of all known easter eggs, I can tell you if that's all of them.
Did anyone ever figure out the pyramid/planet allignment/4 kerbals/weird shape easter egg?

This will crush my dreams of finding it but:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/List_of_easter_eggs

That's all I thinks.

There are more on that list than actually are in the game. Some are just bugs (like the floating rocks, pointy pole on ike and polar pit on moho)

Someday I want to make a small (10m wide), solid cloud on Jool, to allow for legitimate landings. Perhaps it could float around the planet too.

Edited June 4, 2013 by NovaSilisko

Did anyone ever figure out the pyramid/planet allignment/4 kerbals/weird shape easter egg?

That wasn't an easter egg in itself, but a piece of a larger easter egg that hasn't yet been implemented.

List so far (add more if i missed any)

Moho:

-Mohole (the really deep crater)

Eve

- None really (possibly the lone hill surrounded by plains, but it's doubtful)

Gilly

- None found

Kerbin

- 5 monoliths

- 2nd KSC

- memorial MK1 Pod

- temple desert

- north pole saucer

- old parts in island hanger

- smiley face in the ocean (can be seen with the ISA-MAPSAT plugin)

Mun

-Three monoliths

-Three mun Arches

-Neil Armstrong Memorial

-Crashed Saucer

Minimus

- 1 monolith

Duna

- big kerbal face

- singing hill

- rover camera in the ground

Ike

- Magic boulder

Dres

- none really

- The deep canyons can be considered "interesting"

Jool

-none

Laythe

-none

vall

- stonehenge

tylo

- Carl Sagans face in a crater

- "caves"

Bop

-Kraken

Pol

- none (interesting terrain scatter)

Eeloo

-none

MISC

- Bender or some interesting character on the launch clamp texture
I really hope the next version adds more easter eggs to the planets that don't have them. I really enjoy hunting for them.
The launch clamps have Clamps on them.

The launch clamps have Clamps on them.

Wha? Maybe i'm just being gullible, but where?

I don't think of the crater on Moho to be an easter egg, instead more of a geological feature.

Edited June 4, 2013 by Lumaro

Wha? Maybe i'm just being gullible, but where?

I don't think of the crater on Moho to be an easter egg, instead more of a geological feature.

I looked all over. Maybe it got taken out in the latest patch? I know someone a while back posted the texture and it was there. I tried to find the texture files myself but they're not easy to find.

There are more on that list than actually are in the game. Some are just bugs (like the floating rocks, pointy pole on ike and polar pit on moho)

Someday I want to make a small (10m wide), solid cloud on Jool, to allow for legitimate landings. Perhaps it could float around the planet too.

Run by Lando Calrissian?

Waiting for the "uhh, why is the entire list of easter eggs in this thread without some sort of spoiler protection?" post.

Oh wait. There it is.

Wha? Maybe i'm just being gullible, but where?

In the texture file, not visible on the model. That was the last easter egg to be found, I think.

Doesn't make that copyright problems?

Someday I want to make a small (10m wide), solid cloud on Jool, to allow for legitimate landings. Perhaps it could float around the planet too.

that would be so cool. Landing on moving targets.

So, what anout the Moho "Fairies" and the strange gravity forces around the hole on the north pole?

Someone sent a rover expedition to Moho and landed on the equator, then he set for the north pole and had some encounters with these floating lights which he called The "Moho Fairies".

Spooky stuff!

Some are just bugs (like the floating rocks, pointy pole on ike and polar pit on moho)

Well, drat. A perfectly good theory dashed, just like that.

There are more on that list than actually are in the game. Some are just bugs (like the floating rocks, pointy pole on ike and polar pit on moho)

Someday I want to make a small (10m wide), solid cloud on Jool, to allow for legitimate landings. Perhaps it could float around the planet too.

So your saying we've found 'em all?
I don't know why but, I have a feeling that there must be something on Eeloo that we haven't discovered since little venture there

I don't know why but, I have a feeling that there must be something on Eeloo that we haven't discovered since little venture there

I understand you entirely. The only other explanation for putting an empty, frozen, near impossible to reach planet waaaaaay out there is because:

A.) there's an easter egg.

B.) The developers are Trolls.

really hope it's A

So, what anout the Moho "Fairies" and the strange gravity forces around the hole on the north pole?

Someone sent a rover expedition to Moho and landed on the equator, then he set for the north pole and had some encounters with these floating lights which he called The "Moho Fairies".

Spooky stuff!

I might try to find these once I go to Moho, one day.
